title: Encourage don't discourage!
body: I'm sure most of you would have experienced moments in games where other players discourage other players when they make mistakes instead of trying to encourage them. League of Legends is very much a mental game. If you're mindset isn't right then your game play will suffer as a consequence. This is the definition of tilt. When a player makes a mistake, which I can safely say that everyone has done, then don't discourage the player and call them trash or say things like "gg" and or "report x" etc. This will just make that player feel worse. For the better good of your team and for a better chance of winning the game why not encourage the player and boost their moral? I've always gone under the belief that a team that fights amongst themselves has less a chance of winning a game than team of beginner bots. A team that can't function together can't win together. Like, there on your team for Christ's sake.

replies.body:
I always think of the quote "You're already have 5 enemies in the game, why add more".

Everyone has bad games - maybe they are playing off-role or a champion they are unfamiliar with because their main was banned. Like OP said, I find it is better to default to encouragement. At very least it makes the game more enjoyable, even if you lose :
Some people would think that they could take on their entire team and come out on top

To add on to OP's post, don't just encourage. Telling someone: "It's okay, you'll do better next time," which is indeed encouraging, does not always help. Analyzing the mistake and having your teammate realize the solution is just as important. Do not be afraid to be critical and be supportive. Do not be condescending about it, just help your teammate learn and win the game. Remember, teamwork is OP.

Further adding to this, don't be ashamed of your mistakes; instead ask yourself, "What could I have done differently to make that situation go better for me?". Even when you win a trade it is possible to do this.

If you ask this of yourself every time you will not only improve as a player, you will respond more positively to other people's criticism (whether is happens to be constructive or not). You will also be able to give better critism as you are thinking how and what would have been a better decision rather than just telling someone it should of been better or it was a mistake.
